html: EVENTS IN JACOB’S LIFEJACOB was favored by God because he demonstrated deep appreciation for sacred things. (Heb 12:16, 17) Jehovah assured Jacob that his offspring would inherit the land promised to Abraham, and he added: “By means of your seed all the families of the ground will certainly bless themselves.”—Ge 28:4, 10-15.Though he was blessed with material wealth and 12 sons, Jacob’s life was not without difficulties. Yet Jacob never lost his faith in Jehovah and the reliability of his word. Even on his deathbed, he expressed faith in the Messianic promise. (Ge 49:10) Among Jacob’s offspring was born Jesus Christ, through whom God will eternally bless mankind.[Chart/Maps on page 529](For fully formatted text, see publication)Great SeaEGYPTGOSHENSEIRBeer-shebaHebronBethelShechemT.V. of JabbokPADDAN-ARAMHaranEuphrates River[Map]Beer-shebaHebronMamreBethlehemBethelShechemDothanSuccothGILEADMahanaimPenuelSalt Sea[Chart]LOCATIONS ON MAP With Related ScripturesBeer-sheba Ge 28:10Bethel Ge 28:11-19; 35:6-15Bethlehem Ge 35:16-20Dothan Ge 37:13, 17-36Egypt Ge 46:5-7, 28-30; 48:1–49:33Haran Ge 29:4–31:18Mahanaim Ge 32:1, 2Mamre Ge 35:27Penuel Ge 32:24-32Shechem Ge 33:18–34:31Succoth Ge 33:17[Picture on page 530]Beitin, near the ruins of ancient Bethel. At Bethel, Jacob was twice told by God that he was heir to the Abrahamic covenant (Ge 28:13-19; 35:6-13)[Picture on page 530]Ruins of ancient Shechem. Here, association by Jacob’s daughter with Canaanite girls led to her being violated (Ge 34:1, 2)[Picture on page 530]Step Pyramid at Saqqara, Egypt; evidently it existed in Jacob’s day. Jacob spent the last 17 years of his life in Egypt
